clinical_study.official_title: DOLORISK: Understanding Risk Factors and Determinants for Neuropathic Pain - Chronic Neuropathy Following Chemotherapy

collaborator.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

brief_summary.textblock: This is a clinical study which is a follow-up of a previous prospective questionnaire study. All patients who previously participated in the study will receive a new questionnaire and will be invited for a clinical examination.

primary_outcome.description: For case definition of neuropathy, Tesfaye et al. 2010 will be used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensory abnormalities after chemotherapy assessed with quantitative sensory testing (QST).
secondary_outcome.description: Modified German Research Network on Neuropathic Pain QST protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Neuronal excitability changes after chemotherapy assessed with threshold tracking.
Anxiety and depression using the Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Anxiety and depression using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).
Fatigue using the Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Personality using the International Personality Item Pool (IPIP).
Pain catastrophizing using the Pain Catastrophizing Scale(PCS).
Morphology of small fibers in cornea after chemotherapy by Corneal Confocal Microscopy (CCM).

secondary_outcome.description: Potential gene associations in the development of painful neuropathy. It is not currently defined what will measured and reported, but the genetic analysis will be focused on genetic variants that determined pain sensibility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain intensity and interference by Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS).
Pain descriptors by Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI).
Neuropathy using the Toronto Clinical Scoring System (TCSS).
secondary_outcome.description: Total Neuropathy Score, National Cancer Institute-Common Toxicity Criteria (NCI-CTC),the Michigan Neuropathy Screening Instrument.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neuropathy using the Total Neuropathy Score.
secondary_outcome.description: Total Neuropathy Score,the Michigan Neuropathy Screening Instrument.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neuropathy using the Michigan Neuropathy Screening Instrument (MNSI).

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent chemotherapy for a high-risk mamma-cancer and a high-risk colon-cancer from the period of 2011-2012 and who participated in a prospective questionnaire study (Ventzel et al. 2015).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients who have participated in a prospective questionnaire study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not able to visit in person.
